topic.title: Overview of the Elements in the Text Area

body.p: The following table provides an overview of all elements that the DTA basic format provides for the <text> area. Each element is assigned the attributes and (if invariable) values that are possible according to the DTA basic format. Each element is assigned a level that specifies its usage status in the DTA core corpus. Functional categories are also assigned to the elements, which provide information on their usage contexts. The attributes of the DTA basic format that can be used in most of the DTA elements (universal attributes) are documented in the legend for the overviews. There you will also find a more detailed documentation of the levels and functional categories.

entry.i: instead use div , floatingText or p benutzen

row.entry: name of an actor within an actor list

entry.i: is annotated in the DTA corpus standoff

row.entry: function of cell contents for the table ["label"]
selection for changes to the original (transcription/encoding)

manuscripts: person responsible for the supplement ["[pointer]"]
place and time of writing in the letter
structure depth of the text section
written out form of the abbreviation
manuscripts: person responsible for the supplement ["[pointer]"]
link to a representation of the original image ["[pointer]"]
refers to a graphic representation of the formula transcription
unit in which the extent of the text loss is specified ["chars", "lines", "pages", "words"]

entry.p: Documentation: TEI, DTABf, DTABf2, DTABf3, DTABf4, DTABf5,

row.entry: (in the case of strophes:) strophic number
proper name (everything except people, places and organizations)
reference to an external resource that specifies the proper name in more detail ["[URI]"]

entry.p: Documentation: TEI, DTABf, DTABf2, DTABf3, DTABf4

row.entry: reference to an external resource that specifies the proper name in more detail ["[URI]"]

(in the case of normalizations:) regularized form

entry.i: is annotated in the DTA corpus standoff

row.entry: (in the case of correcetions:) incorrect spelling in the original
speaker ID (as assigned to the role)
unit in which the extent of the empty space is specified ["chars", "lines", "words"]
title page within the front matter
concluding text at the end of a text unit
